page.title: 13SHEEP FARMING-NR.HATHERDEN
page.content: On Mr Cherrington's farm there are 1200 breeding ewes, 27 rams and 1800 lambs are born each year.The type of sheep Mr Cherrington breeds is called Mules.The sheep are dipped twice a year for protection against scab. They shear the ewes once a year in the spring then they pack the wool and send it off to the depot where it is auctioned and sent all over the world to make carpets.From December to April they feed the sheep hay.Just before they have lambs he feeds them cake which is a mixture of corn and protein and helps the sheep to produce milk to feed the lambs .He spends $100 per day on animal food.The land is not very good land in Tangley. Mr Cherrington has got 900 acres and of these 600 acres are given to crops.
